samples.context: In aves, body is covered with feathers; while in mammals, body is covered with hairs. Mammary glands are absent in aves.
samples.question: What covers the body of aves?

samples.context: Forelimbs of aves are modified into wings which is not the case in mammals.
samples.question: How are the forelimbs of aves different?

samples.context: Aves are oviparous, while most of the mammals are viviparous.
samples.question: What type of reproduction is most common in mammals?
